resources.string: Remove dependency on Google Play Services
Incorrect project directory. Please enter another one

By clicking "Patch" - you agree that:
 - Decompiled services.jar to smali
 - You made full Nandroid backup
 - Developer of "ApkToolPatcher" is not responsible for Your actions.

Patch modifies services.jar library by removing APK signature verification and integrity check. Patch is configured to modify Android 4.4 ➡ 7.0.X and CM 11 ➡ 13

After clicking the "Send secret" button, you will be asked to send an email with billing information. 
In the message body, indicate:
* the date and time of payment
 * transaction number
* in additional, you can attach screenshot. 
Cost of the Premium version - $1 (per device) 
In response, you will receive an activation code. 
The Premium version contains additional patches and built-in decompiler. 
Account details can be viewed in the menu item - "Donate".
Suggest for new features and get feedback

Try to search by another query
Languages from this list are not affected by deleting locales
Packages from this list are not processed while patching
This features are experimental. They are unstable or can be broken/removed in the future
Account details are copied to the clipboard
ApkToolPatcher Is a secondary tool for editing applications under Android OS.
ApkToolPatcher works ONLY with the finished project obtained after decompiling the application using ApkTool.
The developer of ApkToolPatcher tries to fully automate your work, according to the principle \"chose the project -> pressed the patch button\"!

- Decompile the apk using ApkTool. For example, you have test.apk after decompiling, test_src folder will appear, - this will be the project folder.
- Specify the path to the project folder.
- Press the desired patch button.
- Wait for the end message or error message.
- Open ApkTool.
- Build the project. Patches marked with the Android head icon are relevant for ApkEditor projects.
Video tutorial by InternetMC
Instructions for working with the program
Instructions for converting dictionaries TranslatorApk -> MT Manager

Take folder which contains a dictionary, make a backup, for example this TranslatorApk and rename it to dic.xml. Select the folder with this file and apply the patch/converter. After the patch, change the file format to .mtd. With dic.xml to dic.mtd. The file name can also be changed. All, now this dictionary can be used in MT Manager
Runs GC before each operation has been executed. May cause freezes, but can help on low-RAM devices
Project is not supported by MultiDex

ApkTool not found, here is some cases:

- apktool is not installed on the device
- apktool GUI has been installed, but package name does not equal: per.pqy.apktool
- App failed to get applications data by your system restrictions. For example: (XPrivacy for Xposed/AppOpsXposed/etc.)

You can choose a different ways

ApkToolPatcher is distributed on the principle \'AS IS\'. The developers of ApkToolPatcher make no warranty, Express or implied, that the application will run on firmware other than AOSP. The application is developed taking into account the changes of the last stable branch of the Android Open Source Project, and is not optimized for custom implementation of vendors. If errors occur, make sure to use the latest firmware available for your device. If possible, check the bug on other devices with clean Android from Google
A little bit about MIUI/EMUI/OneUI/Flyme and firmware based on them
